result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent E Faught

defendant.name: Faught, Vincent E
defendant.address: N8232 Hilly Haven Circle Lot 18, Phillips, WI 54555

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent E Faught in court with attorney Lauren O Otto.  Defendant Vincent E Faught in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF59 and 14CF196 called.  State recites agreement.  NGI plea withdrawn.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CF59
Count 1 - Guilty plea
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

14CF196 - DRI

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Attorney Otto requests a furlough.  State requests bond be revoked.  Court will authorize furlough if Attorney Otto can provide written documentation of his sister's circumstance.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Defendant Vincent E Faught in court with attorney Lauren O Otto by phone.  Defendant Vincent E Faught in custody.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reads complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
